Articles.Content:
I have an idea for a mod that adds modular cubes to build rockets with. I have everything planned out and I know how to write the code. I ran into the problem of the .mu files being really hard to create. I spent half the day trying to figure it out and was unable to. I was wondering if anyone could do the exporting for me (I have the .dae files).

The models are here

Feel free to tell me any ideas you have for this mod.

Please send me the files through drop box.

Edited December 14, 2015 by squishybanana

Welcome aboard, squishybanana!

I took the liberty of moving this thread over to add-on development, where it's more likely to bee seen by people who know such about things.

Thanks!

Edited December 14, 2015 by squishybanana

Someone could do this for you, I could do this for you, but you would be better served in the long run learning how to do it yourself. If you wanted to make changes, you'd have to get someone to do it each time. Where are you getting stuck? Unity export, or Unity install?

You do need Unity (preferably 4.2.2 for the time being, for animations) and the Part Tools package for it in order to export them properly. This video by Tiberion helped me greatly:

Thank you. The problem was, and still is the part tools package download link does not work for me. I also tried the blender plugin and tried to export and it didn't work. Is it just me or does the part tools download link also not work for you?

Whoops, forgot about that broken link. Sorry.

Sarbian has a post linking to a copy - http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/59350-023-parttools/&page=3#comment-1863098

Edit: Figured it out

Edited December 14, 2015 by Randazzo
